comments:
hi,

 I'm not sure if this is something wrong with my setup, but I'm getting ClassCastException's from the LanguageManager.

If no-one else is seeing this, I'll have a look at my setup in more detail, but I'm currently using Eclipse 3.3 M4.

The stack trace is:

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.core.internal.content.ContentTypeHandler cannot be cast to java.lang.Comparable
at java.util.TreeMap.getEntry(TreeMap.java:325)
at java.util.TreeMap.get(TreeMap.java:255)
at java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableMap.get(Collections.java:1282)
at org.eclipse.cdt.core.model.LanguageManager.getLanguageForFile(LanguageManager.java:368)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.model.TranslationUnit.getLanguage(TranslationUnit.java:689)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.fast.PDOMFastIndexerJob.doParseTU(PDOMFastIndexerJob.java:89)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.PDOMIndexerTask.parseTU(PDOMIndexerTask.java:237)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.PDOMIndexerTask.parseTUs(PDOMIndexerTask.java:192)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.fast.PDOMFastReindex.run(PDOMFastReindex.java:51)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOMIndexerJob.run(PDOMIndexerJob.java:67)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Run the UI J-Unit tests.  A lot of them are encountering this error.
Checked in a fix to HEAD.  Please verify.
Setting to milestone 4.0 so we can generate a report of all bugs fixed in 4.0.
